A student attempted to confirm that the function <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> defined by <math alttext="f of x, equals, the fraction with numerator x squared, minus 5 x, plus 4, and denominator x squared, minus 6 x, plus 8, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>6</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> is continuous at <math alttext="x equals 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. In which step, if any, does an error first appear?
Step 1: <math alttext="f of x, equals, the fraction with numerator x squared, minus 5 x, plus 4, and denominator x squared, minus 6 x, plus 8, end fraction, equals, the fraction with numerator open parenthesis, x minus 4, close parenthesis, times, open parenthesis, x minus 1, close parenthesis, and denominator open parenthesis, x minus 4, close parenthesis, times, open parenthesis, x minus 2, close parenthesis, end fraction." display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>5</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>−</mo><mn>6</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>8</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>
Step 2: <math alttext="the limit as x approaches 4, of, f of x, equals, the limit as x approaches 4, of, the fraction with numerator x minus 1, and denominator x minus 2, end fraction, which equals, three halves." display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></munder><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></munder><mfrac><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>
Step 3: <math alttext="f of 4, equals, the fraction with numerator 4 minus 1, and denominator 4 minus 2, end fraction, equals, three halves." display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>4</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>
Step 4: <math alttext="the limit as x approaches 4, of, f of x, equals, f of 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><munder><mrow><mi>lim</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>→</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></munder><mo>⁢</mo><mo>⁢</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>4</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, so <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is continuous at <math alttext="x equals 4" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>4</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.

choices.label: There is no error in the confirmation.
